errors.error_description: The dependency installation command for Debian 11/12 is missing the `python3-venv` package, which is essential for creating virtual environments and is explicitly mentioned in the 'Attention' notice.
correction_candidates: sudo apt install python3 python3-pip python3-dev python3-venv libffi-dev libssl-dev libjpeg-dev zlib1g-dev autoconf build-essential libglib2.0-dev libdbus-1-dev bluez libbluetooth-dev git libprotocol-websocket-perl

sudo apt install python3 python3-pip python3-dev python-is-python3 python3-venv libffi-dev libssl-dev libjpeg-dev zlib1g-dev autoconf build-essential libglib2.0-dev libdbus-1-dev bluez libbluetooth-dev git libprotocol-websocket-perl
Run `sudo apt install python3 python3-pip ...` first, and then run `sudo pip3 install venv`.

sudo apt install python3 python3-pip python3-dev libffi-dev libssl-dev libjpeg-dev zlib1g-dev autoconf build-essential libglib2.0-dev libdbus-1-dev bluez libbluetooth-dev git libprotocol-websocket-perl python3-venv
errors.golden_answer: sudo apt install python3 python3-pip python3-dev python3-venv libffi-dev libssl-dev libjpeg-dev zlib1g-dev autoconf build-essential libglib2.0-dev libdbus-1-dev bluez libbluetooth-dev git libprotocol-websocket-perl
